Title: Scar 3D
Original title: Scar 3D
Country: USA
USA release:
Released in Spain: 25/06/2010
Released on DVD (rental): 09/02/2011
Genre: Thriler
Length: 90 Min
Company: DeAPlaneta
Director: Jed Weintrob
Writer: Zack Ford
Starring: Angela Bettis, Kirby Bliss Blanton, Devon Graye, Ben Cotton, ChristopherTituss, Brittney Wilson, Monika Mar-Lee, Brandon Jay McLaren, Carey Feehan, Al Sapienza
Rating: Not recommended for children under 18

Synopsis:
The story of Ernie Bishop (Ben Cotton), the local undertaker, is still on everyone's lips in Ovid, a town in Colorado. The terrible legend was born 16 years ago, but the town still has not recovered. Ernie Bishop teen abducted and imprisoned in the basement of the funeral, in the drawers for the dead. Tortured and inflicted cuts to his victims and taught them the reflection of his sadism in a small mirror. The memories of that time have not been erased. One of his victims, Joan Burrows (Angela Bettis), managed to escape, killing Bishop in his flight, and became a local heroine.

Joan, who left town after the incident and is now a successful real estate agent, returns for the first time after 16 years on the occasion of the coronation of his niece Olympia (Kirby Bliss Blanton) and "Fisher King." But as it arrives, someone starts to imitate Bishop. Kidnapped several teenagers, all friends of Olympia, and appear bloody tracks. At first, Joan fears that Bishop has come back and think you are going crazy. But when Olympia goes away, Joan decides to follow in the footsteps of the murderer. However, a series of unfortunate coincidences makes stopped by the police as prime suspect.

Joan managed to escape with the help of Paul (Devon Graye) and try to get to Olympia before it is too late. He meets his niece in an underground chamber. The murderer kills best friend in Olympia without Joan to stop her, but she manages to save his niece, who becomes a heroine like her.

Notes:
SCAR 3D, the new dimension of terror, shot entirely in 3-D high definition with the same technology that has been used in James Cameron film Avatar.
